page.title: 18SPORTS IN STUBHAMPTON AREA
page.content: As the area is sparsely populated, there is not a great deal of recreation.Because of the unspoilt country side and excellent views, walking is an obvious pastime.The numerous footpaths and bridlepaths crossing the woods and fields provide ample scope for walking,for pleasure and for ecology studies,particularly the Nature Trust areas such as Fontmell Down;Washers Pit and Stubhampton Bottom are also well walked areas.A certain amount of shooting takes place for rabbits, pigeons,pheasants and partridges. Pheasants and partridges are specially reared by one or two of the landowers to provide sport for shooting parties. Fox hunting is another sport which is popular in this area.Horse riding is popular for privately owned horses and nearby breeding stables.
